Name: Out Of The Frying Pan
Description:
A card game of strategic investment, arson, and insurance fraud, where players earn money on restaurants they have a stake in.

Welcome to an epicurean adventure of gastronomical proportions!

It's time to leap from your economically restricting frying pan straight into the incendiary excitement of investing in your own restaurant.

But beware!

The culinary industry poses high risks and vicious competition. In fact, no food vendor has ever turned a profit, since the invention of the restaurant over 4,000 years ago, except for those vendors who moonlight as arsonists.

That's right, your only hope is to collect the insurance money on your establishment. However, burning down your own restaurant is a sure fire way to get yourself put on ice by the fuzz. You'll have to rely on silent partners and the kindness of strangers to light up your livelihood.

Components

* 35 Restaurant Cards
    * 1 First Player Card
    * 42 Investment Markers (7 in each of 6 colors)
    * 50 $1,000 Bills
    * 25 $5,000 Bills
    * Rules for playing Out Of The Frying Pan

Available at http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/out-of-the-frying-pan

Name: Tech Bubble
Description:
In TECH-BUBBLE, 3 to 6 players ride the technology market roller coaster at the turn of the 21st century as it surges and eventually plunges.  The players represent various market sectors during the "Dot.Com Bubble".  They make decisions to stay in the market  and ride out the surge or get out before the bubble bursts.  Timing and nerves of steel are everything.  And along the way players can affect each other's investments and decisions by crafty play.

Due out October 2009

Name: The Soccer Game
Description:
The Soccer Game is played on a square-grid representation of a soccer field, and plays similar to The NHL Game (both somewhat similar to StreetSoccer). A spinner included in the game is used to determine how many spaces the moving side may travel in a turn. The players on the offensive team must move only in straight lines and must make at least one pass every turn, while the opposing team's players may change their direction of movement while moving.
To shoot, the game comes with a 'Power Shooter', that is placed on top of the fielder with the ball. Pressing a button will shoot the ball toward the goal.

The game also comes with a trivia version, where you must answer trivia questions correctly to proceed on offense.

Name: Portfolio
Description:
Players try to build a portfolio of stocks while traveling around a board.

The object of the game is to buy, sell or hold stocks for profit. Each player must determine their own level of financial risk and reward. Players must face real life responsibilities, trying to outperform other players, without going bankrupt. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Comme des Sardines...
Description:
Crazy party game in which players fight laws of sardines. They are kept in so small tins that somebody has to change it!

Every round fop common pool players choose slogans which they will shout during the round. Then they take cards with those slogans, shuffle than and remove one.

Every player in turn takes one card from the pile and shouts the slogan which is written on it, then next one, etc.

One of the player starts to disturb other players by acting as a policeman, reporter, businessman or and old lady.

After pile is exhausted players vote on which slogan was missing scoring points for correct guesses. The disturber scores points according to number of players who did not vote on a right slogan.

Name: Ultimate Fighting Game
Description:
From the Publisher's Web Site:

Enter the exciting world of mixed martial arts!

In UFG, two players take on the roles of powerful fighters. Battle your way through three rounds of elbows, kicks and choke holds. Choose between twenty-five unique characters, each with their own strengths and special abilities.

UFG is a fast-paced, action game that captures all of the danger and excitement of a mixed martial arts brawl. Do you have what it takes to step into the cage?

Name: Troetelbeertjes Regenboogspel
Description: In this game, a cruel professor wants to freeze children's hearts. The players counter this by collecting a rainbow's icicles. An arrow is spun and determines how far a player can move. The squares show symbols which represent actions, notably removing or adding a thermometer chip onto the professor's thermometer. When it is hot enough to melt ice, 16 icicle cards can be collected. When all of them have been collected, they are flipped over and the players can see their value (1-3). The player with the highest number wins.

Name: Desafio da Fortuna
Description: The players roll the dice in this Monopoly Style game for win money and finish the biggest milionaire in the room

Name: Train: The Great Card Game
Description:
Instructions for three games are included: "Train," "Monthly Ticket," and "Matchem."

"Train" - A trick taking game.

"Transfer" - Accumulate 6 identical cards.

"Matchem" - Match identical face up cards with cards in your hand.

60 card deck, with ten each of "Engine," "Engineer," "Conductor," "Fare" "Passenger" and "Monthly Ticket" cards, each with points associated with them.

Name: Girlz Only
Description:
Girlz Only is a fun Girls night in game that finds out exactly what kind of personality you & your friends really have.

Are you a B#tch... a Tart... or an Angel?

Well this game will find out!

Players answer questions on lads, sex etc,.. make lifestyle choices on fashion, makeup, music etc,.. decide on moral dilemmas at work & in relationships,.. act out silly charades and of course down one or two drinks in the process.

Points are scored based on the answers given or how well your perform.

The game is great fun, quite risque and very enlightening & you should be very broadminded to play it.

Don't just have another night in..Have a GIRLZ ONLY night in!

B#tch..Tart..or Angel..you will soon know the truth!

Knickers....red, white or commando?

Your favourite position is?

Your favourite kinky outfit is?

Contents: Game board, Rules, 6 playing pieces, 50 bitch cards, 50 tart cards, 50 angel cards, 50 chance cards, wine glass, dice, score pad.

Name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: High Elves Reinforcements
Description: The embodiment of High Elven martial prowess, the Celestial Guard are an implacable foe. Along with mounted archers, these sublime warriors make a formidable addition to your High Elf army.
Families: Game: Battleground Fantasy Warfare (Your Move Games)

Name: Internet Tycoon
Description:
Be the Internet Tycoon. Attract people to your Sites and build your own digital empire, 
even if you may have to play dirty against the competitors

There are 4 types of cards:


    Sites: your source of money, used to attract and maintain people connected to your services; 
    Upgrades: cards used to raise your Site capacity, increasing the max number of users, your defense against Hackers and Crackers and the incoming you get from the visits; 
    Peopleware: represent experts hired to defend your digital empire or to attack the competitors’ infrastructure; 
    Event: carts turned after each round putting more emotion in the game 


In your turn, player can buy cards, put new Sites on-line, upgrade it, and attract people (from the Internet or the competitors Sites). When no one is looking, you can cut off the power from the computer from the others.

At the end of the game, win the player who has the highest number of people navigating in his Sites.


Seja um Magnata da Internet. Atraia usuários para seus Sites e construa seu império digital, mesmo que para isso seja preciso jogar sujo contra os concorrentes!

Existem 4 tipos de cartas:


    Sites: sua fonte de recurso, usado para atrair e manter usuários conectados em seus serviços; 
    Atualizações (Upgrades): cartas usadas para ampliar a capacidade dos Sites, aumentando a quantidade máxima de usuários, sua defesa contra ataques de Hackers e Crackers, número de usuários e valor recebido por visita; 
    Pessoas (Peopleware): representam os especialistas contratados para defender seu império digital ou para atacar a infra-estrutura dos concorrentes; 
    Eventos: cartas viradas no final de cada Rodada colocando mais emoção no jogo. 


No seu turno o jogador compra cartas, coloca no ar novos Sites, atualiza os já existentes, atrai usuários (da Internet ou do Site dos concorrentes). Quando ninguém estiver olhando, vale até tirar o Servidor dos outros da tomada.

No final do jogo, vence quem tiver o maior número de usuários navegando em seus Sites.

Name: Heia Safari
Description: Dexterity game in which the players use rubber bands to shoot chips onto a game board. The first shot is aimed at catching an animal (which succeeds when the chip stops on a line that is connected to an animal), if the second shot stops in the center field of the game board, the player can release all animals of one kind (from the other players). The first player to catch seven different animals is the winner.

Name: Jet-Set
Description: Players roll dice and walk around a large game board. On each square they land, they have to fulfill certain tasks. However, when they have to draw an event card, for example, they can choose to use it immediately or at any point later. To win, all cards must have been played. During the game, players also have to collect 15 objects (hotels, airlines etc.). And lastly, the winner needs to have at least 100 million dollars.

Name: Gergovie
Description:
This game is a simulation of the assault on Gergovia, Caesar's failed attempt to wipe out the threat of a large Gallic uprising by isolating and defeating a gathering of several Gallic contingents, under Vercingetorix.

66 counters
One hex = 180 meters
10 pages rules book (+scenarios and historical background)

Name: Lago Peipus 1242
Description:
Number 7 of the Italian magazine Giocarea.
Simulation of the battle of Lake Peipus, 1242 AD between the Russian leader Alexandre Nevskii and the Teutonic knights backed by the holy Roman Empire.
One map, 143 pieces
Scale:
one hex = 50 meters
one infantry unit = 200 men
one cavalry unit = 100 knights
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: RolaGolf
Description:
RolaGolf is a game for all the family, young and not so young, golfer or non-golfer, and can be played in a variety of ways:

1. Stroke-Play
2. Match-Play
3. Match-Play Foursomes
4. Match-Play Greensomes
5. Bogey Matches
6. Stableford

The dice (cubes) must be thrown individually in strict sequence: RED (Drive) YELLOW (2nd shot) BLUE (3rd shot) BLACK (4th shot) GREEN (putts); unless the result of the throw indicates otherwise.

The 6 variants have differnt goals to reach. In most forms the player have to reach the most holes in an agreed number of strockes, or to count how many strockes they need for an agreed number of holes.

The matches can be played in pairs what will made a max. 12 of player.

Name: Book Of Mormon Football
Description: After teaching a Book of Mormon lesson, divide the group (or family) into two teams. Place both footballs on the 50 yard line (one above the large football in the center of the board and one below). Each team takes a turn picking a question from the "Question" sack. If they answer it correctly, they then pick a yardage amount from the "Yards" sack. They move their football the indicated amount. Continue taking turns until one team reaches the goal line. Then the team can pick an additional card from the "Extra Point" sack. On a chalk board or piece of paper, keep score. Each team receives 6 points for each goal and the amount of extra points they pick from the "Extra Point" sack. When all the questions have been answered (or time is up), the winners are determined by their score.

Name: Hit the Dirt: WWII Scenarios for Crossfire
Description:
21 scenarios (from 1941 to 1945) to use with the CROSSFIRE rules, or with any other set of rules  for WWII miniatures at squad level.

It includes also new special rules for night fighting, new terrain types, bogging down of vehicles, indirect fire on vehicles, direct fire mortars and the "timing clock" (a mechanic to vary the intensity and pace of a scenario).

Name: Dixit: Quest
Description:
Expansion for Dixit. 84 new cards with paintings that can be used on their own (but then you need some kind of voting tokens and paper and pencil to take notes of the scoring) or with those from the base game (or with Dixit: Journey or Dixit: Odyssey).

The game does not contain scoring board and tokens, but it will be packed in a smaller box in which it is much easier to take it on a trip. This game could theoretically be played as it is, but the components needed to play are contained in the base-game.

As for the game play in Dixit, each round one player takes on the role of Storyteller, choosing one card from their hand and telling a story. Each other player then chooses one card from their hand and gives it to the Storyteller in secret. These cards are shuffled and revealed, then players vote on which card was played by the Storyteller. If no one or everyone votes for the Storyteller's card, they receive no points. If the card received some--but not all--votes, they score three points. Each player who submitted a correct vote or who received a vote on their card submission also scores. The first player to 30 points wins.

Name: Sabotagem
Description:
Cunning and cold-blooded to be the best secret agent! 
During a meeting that took place in a big city with the most powerful world leaders, a suitcase containing invaluable state secrets has been stolen. The best secret agents were summoned to the task of retrieving the information contained in this bag and the winner will receive one million dollar reward, besides knowing the oldest secrets of the mankind. Uncover your opponents and abuse the nerve to not be discovered and enter into history as the best secret agent of all time"(Translated from the game box) 
Each player represents a secret agent, but there may be ghosts agents (additional pawns). On his turn, the player moves any agents, distributing the total movement points obtained among the agents he wants to move. When one or more pawns stop at the building where the suitcase is, all players score: the pawn which is the suitcase’s building receives 5 points and the other pawns receive points corresponding to the buildings where they are at this moment. At the beginning of the game, each player only knows its own identity. Thus, the game has two objectives: to win more points by moving the pawns (the game ends when someone reaches 42 points) and earn additional points, by discovering the identity of other agents (this is done, once someone reaches 32 points, placing numbered chips into the slots of the forecasts bases).

Name: Rebel Moon Defense
Description:
Rebel Moon Defense is a fast-playing game for two, inspired by the Tower Defense genre.

The imperials have discovered the last rebel outpost on a moon colony surrounded by an asteroid belt, and launched a devastating Chaos Bomb to destroy it. The bomb appears at a nearby star gate and heads straight for the base, but the rebels have had time to place automated weapons and booby traps on some of the asteroids.

Will the Chaos Bomb reach the moon and annihilate the rebels?  Or can they destroy it and evacuate their base?

Name: Polygo
Description:
55 playing cards of irregular four-sided shape, and each card can have 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4 different colour segments, plus a letter of the alphabet. 
All games proposed use the same 6 simple matching rules to decide which moves are legal or not.

You can play with them all traditional card games, but the rulebook offers also 11 new and very different games to play:

1) Pentago (for 2-4 players)
By matching your cards by colour with that on the table, you must play all your cards or block your opponents from playing.

2) Polygo Word (for 2-6 players)
The object is to score as many points as possible by forming a single dictionary word of 2 or more letters, using always at least 1 letter from a previous word.

3) Polygo Challenge 2001
A solo game, where you must build a 7x7 block of cards, each matching by colour segment with at least another near card.

4) Astack (for 2-4 players)
Stacking cards you must play all your cards first, or force your opponent to pick more cards.

5) Solo 1
A solitaire game: object is to transfer all cards from the deck to three colums, and then to a final play pile.

6) Solo 2
Beat your own score by drawing cards and playing them on the table only if you can find at least one match with the previously placed cards.

7) Polywords (for 2-5 players)
By placing cards in a crossword style you must form any to or more letter dictionary words.
  
8) 5-Up (for 2-6 players)
A Pentago variant, where cards must by played inside a block a 5x5 cards.

9) Polygo Whist (for 2-8 players)
Win most Tricks and score as high as possible by playing every hand the highest ranking Trump or the highest leading Suit.

10) Polygo Rummy (for 2-6 players)
Be the first to meld all your cards of the same Suit with at least one segment of the same colour.

11) Polygo Shape Puzzles (for 1-8 players)
Try to beat your score or of your opponents by placing cards to form one of five possible shapes with matching cards.

Name: Domin-Up
Description:
"The domino game you build as you play."

This unique set of interlocking stackable dominoes includes a wooden board, 28 wooden dominoes, and a cloth storage bag. Player build up from the board using conventional domino strategy as the stack branches out when a double is played.

Designed for ages 3 and older with safe, non-toxic wooden parts.

Eureka Studios Item #1902

Name: Kilohurtz
Description:
Using “Nano-Bots” as computer programming aids, you are trying to create circuit pathways to allow your nano-bots to complete their assigned programs before your opponents do.

But you’ll have to watch out for other players nano-bots that are trying to throw you off the board into a heat sink, or giving you advanced programing codes you don’t need.  The board has a unique relay system that flips over every time a nano-bot crosses over one, possibly changing your path to victory!

Name: Deep Space Disaster
Description:
Automated alert systems have awakened the crew from Cryo-sleep.  But why?

Deep Space Disaster is the game of Deep Space... and Disasters!

Each player takes on the role of a crew member of the perpetually troubled starship Rabidus Traba.  Players move about and explore by laying cards representing different areas of the ship, thus forming the game board.  As more areas are revealed and useful items are accumulated, things start going wrong, and the closer the ship comes to disaster!

The players don't know when it will happen or even what the disaster may be until it strikes.  The disaster scenario will then lay out how the crew must work together to overcome and survive.  That is unless the secret traitors are able to thwart them!

Deep Space Disaster is a print-and-play game developed as part of a BGG competition. Further development and expansions are planned.

Name: Stratrivia
Description:
Enhance any Trivia game with a dose of Strategy!

The objective of Stratrivia  is to get the highest score in two ways: answering Trivia Questions correctly and controlling as many Strat Squares at the end of the game as possible.
 You do this by moving your piece around the Trivia Board by rolling dice and winning strategic squares on the Strat Board by answering trivia questions correctly (which also give you points).

A+A Games is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5 South Africa LicenseBased on the work distributed at Board Game Geek.

Name: CAPITAL+
Description:
Business game: investments, sales, purchases.

CAPITAL+ is a game of business initiation, for any person 10+ of age, which can be played successfully by the entire family.

Every player is a business person, who has his/her own capital. The capital is invested in the building of industries in various capital cities from Europe.

The industries can be: Consumer Goods Industries (Clothes, Food, Drugs, Installations, Furniture and Computers) and Public Industries (Water, Gas, Transport, Construction, Communicatons and Electricity).

These industries produce different goods; these goods can be sold to the other business partners, also, in some conditions, to the cities.

In order for the industries to function, raw materials must be bought and salaries must be paid. Loans can be taken from the bank, by mortgaging one or many industries.

Name: Socca Dice
Description:
Socca Dice is a little dice game with 2 dice, one with green ink and one with red ink. It is a step by step dice rolling game.

The players start with the green die.  The sides are Pass, Free-Kick, Shoot, Penalty, Robbed, Throw-In which decides if you can throw the dice again, loose and give the dice to another player, or use the red die next.

The sides of the red dice are: Corner, Missed, Cleared, Saved and Goal, the let the player throw again the die, hands the dice to the next player or the goal finishes the round with one point.

The two dice comes along with the rules. The back of the rules can be used as Scoring Chart

Similar to Soccer Dice, albeit with different die faces.

Name: City of London
Description:
The aim is to become Lord Mayor of the City of London. The game is played on a map of the City of London which is divided into 25 Wards and features a route through the City from Old Bailey to the Mansion House and beyond. 20 Wards contain 3 Ward Seats.

Players first gain Wards, using Ward Cards to gain a Seat Majority. They become elected to four Wards in succession using Election Cards and answering questions correctly.  As each Ward is won, players move up the ranks from Freeman, Councilman, Liveryman to Alderman. Now the aim is to become a Sheriff by travelling from Old Bailey to Guildhall.

Sheriffs then travel through the City on a route to the Mansion House that includes the Lord Mayor's Show procession. En route players answer questions and retain correctly answered cards which bear points.

If a Sheriff arrives at the Mansion House with 5 or more question cards they can become Lord Mayor at Guildhall. If no other Sheriifs are on the City route, the Lord Mayor wins outright. Otherwise the Lord Mayor travels from Guildhall towards Mansion House trying to remove the remaining Sheriffs before they reach the safety of their own Wards. A points tally of the top 5 cards determines whether or not the Lord Mayor beats the Sheriffs.

Name: Expedição KV62
Description:
3d Boardgame in the tomb of Tuthankamon...you need reach first the Sarcophage. In the Upper board you need reach the seven passages for the lower board. Each player play with 4 peons. 
The game has a Dice based movement and the objective is to be the first player a reach the Sarcophage Chamber in the Lower Board. Each player can in your movement put obstacles in the path of the adversaries for stop your movement.

Name: Queops
Description:
3d game...the players are a group of explorer trying find the Inner Chamber in the Queops Piramid. A good game for play with the family and friends. Beautiful board. 
Gameplay - the game movement is based in rolling a dice and moving the number rolled in a path. Is possible in your move take cards with advantages or with troubles in your way for inside the Piramid. The Inner board in the piramid has a mechanism for rotate the board and change the tiles, creating Holes or troubles for the peons inside.
The objective of the game is to be the first player to reach the Sarcophage chamber inside the piramid and return for your starting tile.

Name: The Devil's Horsemen: The Battle of Liegnitz
Description:
The Devil's Horsemen is a simulation game of the battle of Liegnitz (Poland), between the Mongol Empire and the combined defending forces of European fighters.
Desktop published containing an 11" x 17" color map, 285 color paper counters (to cut and paste), played an indeterminate number of turns until one side achieves Victory.

NOTE: This game uses the Series: Men of Iron (GMT) system while The Devil's Horsemen: The Mongol War Machine belongs to Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games) series.

Name: Sexy Folies
Description: The object of the game is to gain control of all the parts of the body depicted on the board, thus winning the hidden wager. The players move their tokens round the board and win parts of the body as they go along. When a player lands on a space that already belongs to the other player, he or she must meet a challenge whose 'level of difficulty' depends on how parts of the body the other player has in his or her possession. There are thee categories of challenges: Romantic, Sensual and Erotic. The players can also land in a cabaret in Paris where they will enjoy a striptease performance. Landing on one of Cupid's spaces means that the players have to go along with what he asks them to do and adapt their lovers' play accordingly.

Name: Veturi
Description:
The Veturi (translation Locomotive) game is teaching young children the order of numbers, by placing cards, with carriages numbered 1-10, in sequences after a locomotive card.

To win the game, the player has to be the first to get rid of all his carriage cards, by placing them in the right order from 1 to 10. Bonus cards are used as blank carriages, not effecting the order of the carriage card to be placed next.

Components:
1 locomotive card
50 carriage cards (5 sets numbered 1-10)
4 bonus cards

Name: Das Labyrinth des Minotaurus
Description:
Build a labyrinth for the Minotaur on Crete on behalf of King Minos, but don't forget to worship the gods while building, by erecting statues. Plan your labyrinth well and create good connections in order to be able to reach the hidden treasures fast.

Announced for Essen 2009.

Name: Pitch-em-Winks The Table Horse Shoe Game
Description: Try to get the horseshoe's around the pin. It's like the Tiddledy Winks game. The game consists of 4 1" horseshoes, 2 round disks, a stake, and 2 felt pads.

Name: GoblinFever
Description:
GoblinFever is an easy, funny, interactive cardgame where you can set up the dungeon where your Heroes enter to sweep away the horde of green creatures...
The more Goblins you crush, the more you win!
A Minotaur, a Mage, a she-Elf,a Dwarf, a Dragonman and a mysterious creature will show their... Goblin Fever!

Name: Golliwog Ring Game
Description: Throw the rings around the hooks. The hooks are numbered 1 to 13. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Golliwogg A Round Game
Description:
A pictorial card game. There are 48 cards with pictures from the Golliwogg books by Florence K. & Bertha Upton.
There are 16 sets of 3 cards, marked with a number. The object of the game is to collect as many sets as possible

Name: Arrondissement
Description:
1871; France has just lost the war with Prussia, which ended the rule of Napoleon III. Upon this loss the Parisians organized an revolutionary counsel, the Commune. To rule and control the city each arrondissement had its own elected counsel. ‘Government of the people by the people’ as Marx diagnosed its administration.
But this experiment was about to short lived, in may 1871 the regular French army made an end to the Commune.

In arrondissement the player place their influence in the arrondissements. At the end of each round two arrondissements are valued. The player with the most influence in the valued arrondissement receives points. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

The game is played in nine rounds in which all arrondissements shall be valued. A round begins with a voting phase, by majority of votes the players decide of which 2 routes an arrondissement will be valued at the end of that round (in the last round there is no voting phase, because the remaining 4 arrondissements will be valued). After voting all players play an influence card, and they have the choice of playing an action card. The last phase in a round is the valuation of the arrondissements and the order of play for the next round.

Arrondissement is a game in which planning, waiting and knowing when and where to take control, are the keys to victory.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Module G3A – Supplementary Annexes
Description:
From the back of the book:

Module G3A: Supplementary Annexes includes additional annexes with key daya covering the entire Alpha Octant, completely updated and in some cases entirely new.

Table of Contents: Covering the entire Star Fleet Battles game system for the Alpha Octant.

Annex #5 Abbreviations: An updated and complete list of all those codenames and pesky acronyms.

Carrier Escort Tables: AN entirely new annex never before available in printed form, this lists every carrier in the Alpha Octant and its ever-changing escort and fighter groups.

Master Scenario Index: Listing every ALpha Sector Star Fleet Battles scenario, including year, number of ships, which empires were involved, and special features.  A secondary index allows players to access the Master Scenario Index by year.

Name: Galactic Conquest: A Star Fleet Universe Campaign Engine
Description: The newly-updated Fourth Edition of the most famous campaign rules in the Star Fleet Universe. Use this in the official campaigns or to build your own. Includes everything! Conquest, exploration, alliances, diplomacy, construction, technology development, ships, bases, and a thousand more things. It is designed to use with SFB (it might work with FC if you go to some effort) and assumes you either create your own map or use the map provided by the campaign masters.

Name: Simplexity
Description: The object of Simplexity is simple, be the first player to connect four pieces in a row by shape or by color. But, be careful, your next move may actually help your opponent!

Name: ASL: Journal – Issue Five
Description:
Articles on:

History and the Game: An excerpt from Operation Bluecoat 
Jungle tactics in ASL 
Scenario Analysis of Water Foul from OVHS 
Campaign Game Analysis of OVHS 
More chestnuts from Jim Stahler's fireplace 
Scenario Analysis of Acts of Defiance 
AFV Passengers and Crews 
Scenarios:

J78 Fast Heinz - 10 turns, small OB, 1941 Russia 
J79 Rommel's Remedy - 8 turns, large OB, 1942 Egypt 
J80 Egypt's Last Hope - 7 turns, large OB, 1942 Egypt 
J81 Twisted Knickers - 6 turns, small mostly-armor OB, 1942 Egypt 
J82 Pavlov's House - 7 turns, small OB, 1942 Russia 
J83 Bloody Nose - 7 turns, medium OB, 1942 Russia 
J84 Makin Taken - 7 turns, smallish OB, 1943 PTO 
J85 Ptichin' In - 8 turns, small OB, 1944 Russia 
J86 Frontal Assault - 7 turns, large OB, 1944 France 
J87 Flames of Unrest - 7 turns, large OB, 1944 Poland 
J88 Escape to Wiltz - 7 turns, smallish OB, 1944 Belgium 
J89 Himmler's House - 8 turns, large OB, 1945 Berlin

Name: ASL: Journal – Issue Seven
Description:
The seventh MMP magazine dedicated to the Advanced Squad Leader tactical board wargame, the ASL Journal #7 is 48 pages with 12 scenarios, and a new 8"x22" geomorphic mapboard for Advanced Squad Leader (board "v").

What is "board v"? We have recently changed our map style from hardback mounted (like the original Squad Leader maps) to a lightweight mounted map (that we use in our ASL Starter Kits). Realizing everyone may not be aware of the change, we decided to put a map (which will be in ASL Starter Kit #3) into the magazine to "show it off" to more ASLers. We included a scenario which uses the board, Marders not Martyrs. This map will be used in the Starter Kit games, but is also fully compatible with ASL. Look for it, and future, Starter Kit maps to be used in ASL scenarios.

Journal #7 contains articles on:

The Blue Devils - Croation Parachute Battalion 
Commissar's Dialectic 
Got OVHS? Got Milk Scenario Review 
Hungry, Hungry, HIPpies 
The British in WWII (part 2 of 2) 
Feline Off-Board Artillery (FOBA) 
Scenarios:

122 Extracurricular Activites - 5.5 turns, 1944 Hungary 
J102 The Yelnya Bridge - 4.5 turns, 1941 Russia 
J103 Lenin's Sons - 6.5 turns, 1941 Russia 
J104 Flanking Flamethrowers - 6.5 turns, 1941 Russia 
J105 Borodino Train Station - 5.5 turns, 1941 Russia 
J106 Marders not Martyrs - 5.5 turns, 1942 Russia 
J107 Operations Schwartz - 6.5 turns, 1943 Croatia 
J108 Danica Air - 5.5 turns, 1943 Croatia 
J109 Break for Hungary - 6.5 turns, 1943 Croatia 
J110 Prelude to Spring - 8 turns, 1944 Hungary 
J111 Prussia in Flames - 8 turns, 1945 East Prussia 
J112 Prelude to Dying - 7.5 turns, 1945 Slovenia

Name: Chairman of the Board
Description:
The position has now become vacant and a new Chairman has to be appointed. Are you ready to take up the challenge and become Chairman of the board?

Your first task will be to acquire enough Company shares to gain access to the Promotion area. You will then have to maneuver yourself into becoming a Manager. Your next target will be to acquire a Directorship and finally to become Chairman.

There will be many obstacles along the way and your position is never safe.

From the start your opponents will try to stop you, they will try to block you, they will try to buy you out or sell you out. Trading, dealing, bidding and bargaining are all part of the game. The cards you hold can influence your decision and determine your progress.

When is it an opportune time to call and make your move? Is it wise to wait another hand? Have you chosen your right card to acquire your Company share? You can use your Veto card to block another opponent, but is it the right time?

The Joker can be your best friend or your worst enemy. Will you have enough Personal shares to continue the challenge?

Your opponents have no scruples and will show you no mercy! Remember, they too want to become Chairman of the board!
Have you got what it takes?

Name: Hook, Line, and Sinker
Description: A hilarious card game of cons, swindles, and scams!  Players use cards to build the best scam and then vote on which scam they would fall for.  The player with the most votes after several rounds wins.

Name: Heidanei Schneggahofa
Description:
In this re-themed edition of Ausgerechnet Buxtehude, we are now trying to learn the geographical locations of cities and sights in the Bavarian administrative region of Swabia.

Players place cards on the table according to their relative location. Other players may doubt the accuracy of the placement you made. Should the accusations turn out to be true, you would have to give out a scoring marker. The player with the most scoring markers in the end wins.

In addition to the 135 location cards the game contains 65 quiz cards about Swabian words and knowledge. Two quiz rounds interrupt the normal game play.

Name: The Mole's Garden
Description:
The little mole and his friends move in 3 dimensional game board. Who first obtain 4 various images? During the game children can discover various objects.
Easy game for the little ones. You can choose between four characters (all cute)! You roll the colorful dice and then you need to choose where to go. You can only choose between the spots the dice rolled up. Be the one who collects the most treasure and win!

Content of the box:
1 three-dimensional game board
4 wooden pieces (mole, hare, mouse and hedgehog)
16 cardboard images
1 plastic bag
1 colourful dice
CZ and SK instructions

Name: Perpetual Commotion: 2-Player
Description:
A Hullabaloo for Two!

2-Player Perpetual Commotion is especially designed for two-player speed and excitement.

In a fast-paced duel to be first to reach 150 points, race your opponent to play as many cards as you can into a center Arena. Earn extra points by being the first to empty your Feeders pile - but watch out! A single roll of the eight-sided die can change your score.

It's the commotion you'll want to create again and again!

Name: Roll-UM Baseball
Description: From the Rulebook: Roll-um baseball is played with one or two players. Each game takes approximately 20-40 minutes. Using the Roll-um Dice Code printed on the vinyl game surface, players roll dice, and score each at-bat on the game score sheets. Keeping score is done for nine innings, or until completion of a game.

Name: Oubliette
Description:
Incarcerated and forgotten beneath the castle keep, four prisoners finally break out from their dank cells. The torch-lit catacombs shift magically, opening new paths for some and sealing off passages for others. Will you navigate the shifting tunnels and be the first to exit the oubliette to win your freedom?

Players will use cards to move themselves toward the exit, move their opponents away from the exit, and change the maze itself to suit their purposes.

Name: On a Roll
Description:
ON A ROLL is a dice game for two or three players. Components consist of a 9x9 board, five standard dice and chips in three colors. Each square on the board is printed with either a dice combination or a special rule.

The object is to align five chips in a row on the board to form a "run". The winner will be the first player to form three "runs".

The player rolls all five dice one to three times, setting aside dice during the previous rolls. The player must use the highest combination of the final roll. After the final roll, the player places a chip on the board that matches that roll. If all matching squares are already filled, that player's turn is over and may not place a chip on the board.
Play then proceeds to the next player.

Additional team action: Four players are divided into two teams of two players. Team members sit opposite each other. In addition, the board is divided with a neutral zone separating team members. Team members may only play in their own zone and the neutral zone.

Six players may divide into two teams of three or three teams of two. Team members sit opposite of each other. The neutral zone is optional.

Name: Check 4
Description:
Check 4 bills itself as “the most exciting change to the game of checkers in 300 years!”

Check 4 consists of seven different games for two or four persons or teams:

Four-Way Checkers - The traditional checker game played with four people with some rules changes.

Teleportation - Uses special board squares allowing players to move and materialize at other places on the board. 2 or 4 players.

Players Chance - Same rules as Four-Way Checkers, played with dice. The dice determine who is allowed to move each turn. 2 or 4 players.

Six-Piece Checkers - Each player starts with six pieces.  Additional pieces may be earned as the game progresses. 2 or 4 players.

Decoy -  Each player has 12 pieces, consisting of six pieces of two colors each. One set is real, the other is a decoy. 2 players.

Protection - Each player has 12 pieces, 3 of which are a different color. Get one of the special pieces home safe to win. 2 players.

Super Diagonal - Each player has 12 pieces, 4 of which are a different color. The four special pieces are allowed to move more than one space at a time. 2 players.

The board is an 8x8 grid, with an additional 3x8 starting section along each side for each player. The checkers come in four sets of 12.

Name: Monopoly of Three Kingdoms
Description:
This is a monopoly-like game with three kingdom's theme.Roll your dice,buy locations,employ generals to conquer other lords and unite ancient China.

Some rules differences between this and Monopoly:


         Each player starts with a property and their starting space is that starting property rather than the Go space (called the palace in this game). For example, Cao Cao starts the game at Chen Liu and owning that deed.
             In addition, the colored set corresponding to the starting property of that pawn is also free to purchase for that pawn when landing on it. For example, Cao Cao can buy any blue property (including Chen Liu if he ever lost it, Shou Chun, or Xia Pi) for free when landing on it and no one owns it.
        
         No bonus for completing a colored set.
             Unlike monopoly, you can start building "houses" (camps in this game) even w/o collecting a complete colored set.  However, you can only build them when you land on a property and only on that property.
             Only 3 houses before a "hotel" (city [walls] in this game).
        
         Free parking space replaced by a Shrine space where if you land on it, any accumulated money in that space is split between the player that landed on it and the bank at around 50/50.
         Jail/Just visiting space replaced by maintenance space
             Each player pays 200 taels [aka gold] per property owned (doesn't matter about houses).  
             Player who pays the LEAST money from this gets a free camp built on a property of their choice.  Money paid for maintenance goes to the shrine space.
        
         Go to Jail space replaced by a Disaster Aid space. 
             Each player pays 10% rounded down to the nearest 100 taels of their current cash on hand to the shrine space.  
             The player that pays the MOST money from this gets a free camp built on a property of their choice.
        
         Community Chest cards are called Secret Pouches (ala Zhuge Liang) and are generally somewhat more powerful than in Monopoly, though some are still weak as well.
         Chance spaces replaced by a Tavern space where you can recruit officers to join you.  
             Only 3 officers are displayed at a time and these 3 are replaced whether or not you recruit one after landing on a Tavern Space.
             Each player can recruit a total of 3 officers, which each officer having a special passive ability specific to that officer.  For example, Diao Chan forces an opponent paying rent to you to pay an additional 1500.  Lu Bu allows you to not pay any rent for landing on a space, but after using him, you must put him back at the bottom of the officer draw deck.  
             There are a total of 30 officers to choose from.
        
         After a player goes bankrupt, that player actually submits to the player that caused the bankruptcy.  
             The bankrupt player is now considered a Subordinate while his master is considered the "New Ruler".  
             They share resources, officers, and properties. The New Ruler essentially gets to move two pawns per turn instead of one, with the Subordinate rolling his own moves but the results of the space the Subordinate's pawn landing on being resolved by the New Ruler.  
             This keeps the subordinate tied to the game instead of being completely eliminated.  When the ruler wins, the subordinate gets second place.  
             There can be multiple levels of subordinates as a result of cascading bankruptcies etc. 
        
         The game is won when only one ruler is left and the rest are his subordinates.
    


Overall, a more complex game than monopoly, especially cause of the officer cards and the somewhat more powerful community chest.  Also, the free camps from the maintenance and disaster aid spaces promote hoarding of cash while developing only a few properties normally.  Easily expandable to 6, 7, or 8 players, really. Though that'll increase the game length dramatically, of course.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Ampumahiihtopeli
Description:
Ampumahiihtopeli (translation from Finnish: The Biathlon game) is about biathlon, the combination of cross-country skiing and shooting targets.

The players compete to be the first to reach the goal line, by moving along a track on the board. In individual competition, each player will visit the shooting range twice and at each time try to hit all the five targets at their slot on the range. Shooting takes place through rolling the die, and trying to hit the numbers 1-2-3-4-5, in any sequence, per time at the shooting range. For each miss, the player will have to do an extra penalty lap.

The game, along with the cover picture, was approved by SAhL (Finnish Biathlon Association) with the SAhL logo and a signed endorsement from the then executive director Pauli Swanljung on the box front, and probably originates from late 1970s - early 1980s.

Name: Calculae
Description:
Introduction
Calculae is a card game involving basic arithmetic. Players use cards to form math expressions that evaluate to a desired result. It is an educational and fun game for people who want to improve and exercise their arithmetic skills.

Number of players
1 - 4

Setup
Deal 5 Poker cards to each player. Place the rest of the Poker cards face-down in a Poker draw pile, the Operator cards face-up in the middle of the table, and the Result cards face-down in a Result draw pile.

Multi-player Game Play (2-4 players)
During the start of each round, put the top card from the Result draw pile on the table face-up in a Result discard pile. Each player then selects 2 or more Poker cards in his hand such that using these cards and at least 1 Operator card, he is able to form a math expression that evaluates to the number on the face-up Result card. Jokers can represent any number from 1 to 13.

All players put their selected Poker cards in front of them face-down. If a player thinks he is unable to form any correct math expression with his current hand, he has to place all his 5 Poker cards face-down. Once all players have done this, each player reveals his selected Poker cards and take turns to form the expressions with the Operator cards. If the player forms the expression correctly, then he places his Poker cards face-down in front of him in his Score pile.

For the player who is unable to form any expression and has placed his 5 Poker cards on the table, he will reveal his cards and other players have a chance to form an expression. Any of the other players may shout “Calculae!” and then start to form an expression. If the expression is formed correctly, he gets to keep the Poker cards used in his Score pile.

If a player makes an attempt to form an expression, either using his Poker cards or other player’s Poker cards, and is unable to do so or forms an incorrect expression, he will have to discard 3 cards from his Score pile to the Poker discard pile face-up.

Once all players have verified their expressions formed, they draw Poker hands to fill their hand to 5 and the next round starts where a new Result card is revealed. The new Result card is placed on top of the current Result card.

Continue playing until either the Poker draw pile or the Result draw pile runs out. The winner is the player with the highest Score.

Solitaire Game Play (1 player)
All the rules are the same, except that the player has to discard all his cards at the end of a round, whether he has formed an expression or not. Then he draws 5 new Poker cards for the next round. The aim is to score the highest Score.

Name: Suunnistuspeli
Description:
Suunnistuspeli (translation from Finnish: the Orienteering game) is a game to teach children how to do orienteering, by learning map denotations and the points of the compass.

The goal of the game is to go through five checkpoints on the map. The spin of the compass is used to find a good direction and the die decides the distances the player can go on the map grid. Movement is restricted that the players cannot walk over the lakes, marshes or planted fields on the map.

The game was produced in cooperation with the Finnish Orienteering Federation, and dates probably from the early 1980s.

Name: Glokess
Description:
Glokess is an abstract game. Players place pieces on the board, then moves or rotate them in order to capture the opposing pieces. The inspiration for the game comes from Blokus, Go, and Chess.

Setup
Each player gets the all the pieces of the same colour. The pieces are coloured on both sides.

Game Play
Each player alternates in taking turns. During the player’s turn, the player can perform 1 on the following 
(1) place a piece on the board 
(2) move a piece already on the board
(3) rotate a piece already on the board. 
(4) flip a piece already on the board

The piece rotates with its black square as its axis, and can be rotated any number of right angles. After rotation, its black square must be at the same location. Similarly, if a piece is flipped, its black square must be at the same location.

Each piece moves according to its structure. Taking its black square as the center, the piece moves to any of the coloured square.

Name: Word Ace
Description: "Word Ace combines the strategy and competition of Texas Hold 'Em with the intellectual challenge of classic word games."  The deck consists of 100 letter cards, each with a point value.  Dealing and betting structure is identical to Texas Hold 'Em; however, the remaining player with the highest scoring word wins the hand.  Players may use all seven cards (two hole cards and five community cards) in the formation of their word.  Long words add point bonuses: 5 letters = +2 points, 6 letters = +5 points, and 7 letters = +20 points.

Name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Skavenblight Threat
Description:
From FFG site :

Boneripper, quick quick. Bite slay kill!

The Warhammer LCG is getting a dose of warpstone. Sneaking onto the scene are the vile forces of the Skaven! These ratlike parodies of men are some of the most vicious fighters the Warhammer world has ever seen. The Skaven would easily take over the world, if they could stop fighting themselves long enough to do it.

Each race gets new cards, and each side sees new allies.

The forces of Order gain some powerful new tactics, such as Infiltrate for the Empire and Stand Your Ground for the Dwarfs. Tyriel, a new hero for the High Elves, forces an opponent to reconsider his attack if he has limited units to send.

Destruction’s mighty followers gain the might of Malus Darkblade, of the Dark Elves. A master of the blade, this Dark Elf Hero will lay waste to any unit too cowardly to face him on the fields of battle. Tzeentch exerts his influence by granting Chaos the use of Bolt of Change! This spell turns a development into a unit, giving Chaos some extra firepower, or setting up a foe to have his development killed on the fields of battle.

In addition the forces of Destruction gain the duplicitous help of the Skaven. This first pack features the services of Greyseer Thanquol, Clan Rats, and the awe-inspiring majesty of the Warp Lightning Cannon!

The forces of Order see their ranks swell with the presence of Witch Hunters. The first to appear is Marius the Righteous. This heroic character is able to deal a devastating blow to any corrupted unit.

The Skavenblight Threat is the first pack in the Corruption Cycle, a set of six linked packs highlighting the forces of the Skaven, Witch Hunters, and the seductive arts of magic.

Expands :

    Warhammer : Invasion
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: ASL Action Pack #6: A Decade of War
Description:
(from the back:)

A Decade of War, the sixth "action pack" for Advanced Squad Leader, covers nearly ten years of world-wide conflict, from the 1936 Nationalist drive to capture Madrid during the Spanish Civil War, to Japanese engagements with the Allies in Asia and the Philippines, to the death throes of the Third Reich on the Eastern Front.

The ten scenarios spanning this period were developed with tournament players in mind, and are designed for an "expert" level of game knowledge; yet they are accessible to the casual player as well since A Decade of War includes, for the first time, optional "Australian Balancing System" (ABS) provisions for each scenario. (ABS was devised almost two decades ago to allow for scenario side selection via a series of escalating handicap bids. Each player secretly bids on which side and at what handicap level they wish to play; the higher the bid, the greater the handicap.)

Three double-sided 11x16 mounted maps, including a unique river bend, round out the package. Each is completely geomorphic, and compatible with previous ASL mapboards. Offering new and novel map configurations, these are sure to spark the interest of designers and players alike.
 A Decade of War contains: 

    3 ASL 11x16 double-sided geomorphic mapboards (1a/b, 2a/b, 3a/b) 
    10 ASL scenarios featuring the new maps.


Scenarios: 

    AP53 Far From Home - 7 turns, 18 December 1936, Boadilla del Monte, Spain 
    AP54 800 Heroes - 5 1/2 turns, 29 October 1937, Shanghai, China 
    AP55 The Generalissimo's Own- 6 1/2 turns, 26 May 1938, Lanfeng, China 
    AP56 Quagmire - 10 turns, 22 September 1939, Shangfu, China 
    AP57 Kleckerweise - 9 turns, 14 May 1940, Bulson Road, France 
    AP58 Sat Sri Akal! - 7 turns, 2 January 1942, Kampar, Malaya 
    AP59 Taking Heads - 6 1/2 turns, I January 1942, Concepcion, Luzon 
    AP60 Nisbne, Nyet! - 7 1/2 turns, 10 February 1943, Nishne-Gnilovskaya, Russia 
    AP61 Desobry Defiant - 7 turns, 19 December 1944, Noville, Belgium 
    AP62 Shouting into the Storm - 6 1/2 turns, 8 February 1945, Klein-Silber, Germany


A Decade of War is not a complete product, and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.



(source: ?)"MMP has reached an agreement with three ASL legends to produce a new Action Pack. AP6—The Decade of War—will have three new mapboards and ten scenarios using them.

When talking ASL, Gary Fortenberry, Charlie Kibler, and Bob McNamara need no introduction; all three were major figures in ASL at The Avalon Hill Game Company before MMP took over ASL development. The new mapboards—based on a concept that Gary has been toying with for a number of years—resemble two half-boards placed side-by-side and allow new mapboard configurations not possible before. The scenarios consist of a battle a year for the ten years 1936-1945 and feature the combined research and design skills of Fort, Charlie, and Mac."

Name: Swedish Volunteers
Description:
From the producer:

This is Swedish Volunteers - bringing the Swedish Volunteers' order of battle into the Advanced Squad Leader system, thus enabling you to command every major gun, support weapon, and troop type used by the Swedish Volunteers throughout the war.


     Märkäjärvi, Finland, 27 February 1940
     OS, Norway, 2 May 1940
     Shemenski, Russia, 18 April 1942
     South of Näätälä, Finland, 21 June 1944
     North ot Tali, Finland, 25 June 1944


http://www.marmeladov.com/svevol/

This scenario pack requires the following:

    Advanced Squad Leader
    Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
    For King and Country: ASL module 5a or West of Alamein: ASL Module 5
    The Last Hurrah: ASL Module 6 or Doomed Battalions: ASL Module 11
     Mapboards: u, 2, 5, 8, 10, 17, 19, 24, 34, 38, 42, 44, 50, 52
     Overlays: OW1, O3, Wd5, B2, B4, St3, 4, Hi2, Hi3, and Hi4 are required


(one scenario also requires overlays Wd2, OG2, P1, M4, Wd1, M2, P2, M1, OG1, M3, Wd4, P3 and B1).

Name: Landslagets fotbollsspel
Description: A simple card-driven soccer game where you try to get ball (the only playing piece) into the opponents goal. Issued by the Swedish Football Association to promote the '92 European Championship and the '94 World Championship.

Name: Hannibal Against Rome
Description:
Hannibal Against Rome is a low-complexity simulation of the Second Punic War between Rome and Carthage. Based on the classic White Dog Games computer game of the same name, the game challenges players by confronting them with the strategic decisions that faced Hannibal and his Roman foes.

Game Features

* Two-Person or Solitaire Play
    * Twelve-Page Rules Manual
    * 34 x 18 Hex Game Map In Full Color
    * 120 Counters
    * Solitaire Play Rules
    * Available in PDF Format

Name: Classico
Description:
A trivia quiz game about classical music.

Players roll and move their pawn on a board with different colored squares. There are five colors, corresponding to five categories of questions (history of music, opera, instruments, man and music, recognizing music fragments). You must answer a question of the category corresponding to the color you land on. Your turn ends when you give a wrong answer.
For each category of question there is one special square on the board. When you answer correctly there, you earn a category token. The first player to win a token for each of the five categories wins the game.

The game comes with a board, 198 cards with questions, 2 CD's with music fragments, category tokens and a regular die. The player tokens are images of busts of famous composers.

Name: Classico Junior
Description:
A trivia quiz game about classical music. It's in Dutch.
The game is targeted at children of age 8 and older.

Name: The Great Estate
Description:
The Game of the Good Life! - from Hasbro's Family Fun Games line.  To win the game you must be the first player to own all of the 12 items on your luxury board - to complete your "Great Estate".

The box pictures Jerry Lewis with his signature.

Contents include:

- Playing Board (Large plastic board 25 in. x 25 in. by 4 in. high)
    - 4 Luxury Boards (12 items each)
    - 48 Chips; 12 to each player
    - 32 Business markers; 8 to each player
    - 1 pair of dice
    - Play Money
    - Fortune Cards (25)
    - Risk Cards (15)
    - I.O.U. Cards (18)

Name: Alien Sen So
Description:
Yes, you are an Alien! All you need to know: Is it a predator or prey? You will send in a spawnling to find out. If it is prey, then this battle will be over quickly. If it is a threat, then caution and strategy may be required to take it down. Either way you will be the last thing standing when the acid blood is done spraying.

The Alien brings Acid Blood and Spawnlings to Sen So.  If you like causing damage and chasing down your foes, the Alien is perfect for you.  The Alien is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Archer Sen So
Description:
Yes, you are an Archer! You have sharp eyes and a steady hand. Distance is your ally and few can avoid your deadly shots. If you can see the target you can hit it. You have many targets to choose from; it is now just a matter of which one to start with.

The Archer brings 8 unique cards and introduces the full set of Aim cards to Sen So.  If you like ranged combat and keeping your foes on there toes, the Archer is perfect for you.  The Archer is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Gladiator Sen So
Description:
Yes, you are a Gladiator! You have two strong arms, one for each weapon. The enemies are new, but this is nothing new, arena combat is your life. The crowd and you grow restless; it is time once again to bask in yet another victory.

The Gladiator brings the Gladius, Spatha, Parma(shield) and Net to Sen So.  If you like dual wielding and dishing out damage, the Gladiator is perfect for you.  The Gladiator is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Robot Sen So
Description:
Yes you are a robot! Does that compute? Designed as the ultimate fighting machine combat is all you know. Any opponent that faces you in the arena will be put to the test. You cannot and will not be stopped! All other contestants will fall before your next rest cycle. It is time for you to do what you were made for…FIGHT!

The Robot brings Metal Hide and Repair Kits to Sen So.  If you like steady resilience and recovery, the Robot is perfect for you.  The Robot is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Space Hunter Sen So
Description:
Yes, you are a Space Hunter! Everything is your prey. Big or small, you hunt it all. Technology is your aid, but it is only used to enhance the thrill of the hunt. You delight in surprising your target, but savor when it surprises you. You have found something interesting, let’s hope it is fun to stalk.

The Space Hunter brings Auto Laser, Force Shell, Self Destruct and Distortion Shell to Sen So.  If you like starting with an advantage and having tricks up your sleeve, the Space Hunter is perfect for you.  The Space Hunter is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Viking Sen So
Description:
Yes, you are a Viking! Your fierce flying attacks are legendary. Leading with your Axe, you force your foe to give way or pay the price. Not many understand or appreciate the power of a sharp axe, now is the time for you to show them.

The Viking brings the Hand Axe, Shield and War Axe to Sen So.  If you like being aggressive and keeping your foes at bay, the Viking is perfect for you.  The Viking is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Zombie Sen So
Description:
Yes you are a Zombie! You will never be at rest. You “live” to make sure nothing else does. Everything must die, if it moves it must die. How did you get in this arena? It does not matter…Look! There is something moving over there…it is time to KILL once again.

The Zombie brings Squishy Flesh and Arm-O-Rang to Sen So.  If you like not having to think about what to do or being able to take a hit, the Zombie is perfect for you.  The Zombie is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Pirate Sen So
Description:
Everyone has a nemesis and the Pirate has the Ninja.  Sen So started out as a Ninja Combat Board Game.  Wells it is now more than that.  The Sen So Pirate is the balanced counter part to the Ninja.  Same abilities with a Double Flintlock pistol for one extra shot.  If you don’t like Ninja and have a Pirate spirit, the Sen So Pirate is perfect for you.  The Pirate is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.  Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

Name: Abwrack Prämie: Das Spiel
Description:
The title, translated into English, might be: "Scrapping Premiums: The Game".  Players attempt to control routes to recycling centers, where they exchange their plastic "clunker" cars for aluminum ones.  This game was created by a German auto parts manufacturer to keep his metal milling machines in use during an economic downturn.

Players drive around the board in their old cars. When they pass certain squares, they get money from the bank. When they have enough money, they can go to the car dealer in the center of the game board to exchange their old car for a new one, then drive home with it, kicking out other old cars on the way. When a player has no more old cars and has brought all the new ones home, the game ends and the richest player (in cars and money) is the winner.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Module H1 – Megahex
Description:
Details
From product description:
This product includes one-inch full-color counters for use with STAR FLEET BATTLES or FEDERATION COMMANDER. You must have a map with 1.25" or larger hexes (such as SFB Module W, or in any of the FEDERATION COMMANDER boxed sets).

Expands...
The original 'Module H1: Megahex' and 'Module H2: Megahex 2' were products exclusively for Star Fleet Battles, using hand-drawn art for the ship counters. These products have both been combined and replaced with the current 'Module H1: Megahex', published in 2005, and intended for use with both the Star Fleet Battles series and the Federation Commander series|Federation Commander Series

Includes:
320 1" counters with CGI art by Ted Geibel

Name: Numéro 10
Description:
Numéro 10 is a soccer game. 2 players try to score with tactical moving of their players.
A player can choose to move a player, the ball or a player with the ball. The other player has to defend by placing players in the lines before his opponent.

Play 2x 45', like a real match.
This game self-published with superb materials.

Name: Classic Dinner Party:  Dine with William Shakespeare and Anne Hathaway
Description:
A dinner party for 8 people intending to recreate a setting similar to one in Shakespeare's time.  This only slightly qualifies as a game as the box includes a small set of trivia cards to play with during the dinner.  It is intended more as a fun dinner with a theme.

From the box: "This box contains the ingredients for a unique and historic dining experience. You and your guests can travel back in time, taste the flavours, discover the story and become part of one very special moment in European history."

The game consists of 48 trivia cards to divide amongst two teams after the meal.  The team with the most correct answers wins the game.

Name: Trail to the White House
Description: Goal: To be elected President of the United States.  You and your opponent will engage in a series of "debates" (game rounds) over seven Issues.  Each player will be attempting to gather the most support for her platform.  The winner of each Issue will garner votes from the various Regions.  Plan your campaign, manage your resources carefully, and win!

Name: Monkey Rummy
Description:
At last... a rummy game with Monkeys! Every type of monkey has a different ability and you can either play them for VP (well, bananas) or play them for their action. You can only play one action card a turn but if you have a meld of monkeys in front of you, you get to play their action for free each turn.

This game is an entry to the Themed Rummy Design Contest Judged by Mike Fitzgerald

Name: Cuba Cube
Description:
There is no easy life in Cuba. No work and no money. You take what you get. Even a beaten old car and a job from a local smuggler-of-a-boss. Your driving skills are going to be tested really hard. You will be facing dangerous mountain passes and old forgotten smuggling routes. And last but not least the police is tighting on your heels! A skilled smuggler takes it in one’s stride and he knows what, when and where to sell with profit and how to cheat the cops and the competition… Cuba Cube as a game of dice is a unique combination of tactics, strategy and skill. Cuba Cube offers 5 distinct ways to play – 5 full-fledged games:

Deathmatch – each against each for 2 - 5 players, 60 mins.
Cooperative – all against the game for 1 - 6 players, 50 mins. 
Race – action-packed race for 2 – 5 players, 30 - 60 mins.
Business – a business strategy for 2 – 4 players, 50 mins.
Team Play – team-gaming for 6 – 10 players, 60 – 90 mins.

Game contents:
4 City cards
5 Pawns
12 Dice and 2 Sticker sheets
75 Goods, Police and Bumper tiles
36 Road cards and 16 Vehicle cards
25 Damage counters
A Boss, a Police and a Goal card
2 Distance rulers
A Pack of 1000 and 2000 Pesos
A comprehensible Guide for the 5 Game Variants in Czech and English

Name: Feeding the Alphabet
Description:
Feeding the Alphabet is a children's educational game designed to teach the alphabet. The game comes with two types of cards, one that has a letter on it and the other that has a picture of food. Players take turns drawing cards trying to match the letters to the food items, i.e. C - Cheese, O - Onion, H - Hot Dog.

The winner is the player who makes the most matches.

Name: Circulix
Description:
Based on the game concept of Circulus, in this game players use 9 dice to form a kind of snake. With this they wiggle around on the game board, taking away one or multiple dice on one and and adding them to the other. Then they try to circle the trophies which are placed on the board beforehand. 
The players roll six (neutral) dice and can use them for their movements. They can use a die result to move a corresponding snake die, add two dice to move a snake die or divide a result to move two snake dice (but not use two results to move two snake dice with the same sum). Every time they claim a trophy, they can reduce their snake by one die, making it faster and more flexible that way.

Name: Varázsfazék
Description: Players are cooks in this game, they have to buy the ingredients listed in the recipe. They move on the board according to the results of dice from the start to the end, but in the "shops", special areas they can move in both directions. They have to move exactly to the appropriate place in order to buy an ingredient. During the game they also have to answer some trivia questions about cooking. The first one to arrive at the endpoint wins.

Name: Jani bácsi szórakója
Description: Every player gets seven letters and has to write down words made using these letters. After two minutes, everybody gets his/her neighbor's letters, this way everybody has the same chance.

Name: Full On AFL
Description: Full On AFL is the new action packed, Aussie Rules Football board game. It uses no trivia questions - just a unique Directional Dice to shoot and score! Non-stop, full-on, family fun!

Name: CATAN: Treasures, Dragons & Adventurers
Description:
This expansion pack contains additional material for some scenarios, which could be played until now only with some handicraft work.

It includes material for 6 scenarios:  Die Wüstendrachen/Wüstenreiter (The Desert Dragons), Der große Kanal (The Great Canal), Verwunschenes Land (The Enchanted Land), Die Schatzinseln (The Treasure Islands), and enough material for Groß-Catan (Greater Catan), so that you no longer need a second base game for it.  Plus, there is a new scenario, Aufbruch ins Ungewisse (Departure Into The Unknown).

The expansion was first released in October 2009 and after that the German Language rules became available for download from www.catan.de. Rules have been reviewed - current version is v8 from 23th october 2013.

Now this expansion is finally receiving An English version that is expected to be released in July 2021 and after that the rules will be available for download from www.catan.com.

The Expansion contains:

     18 Terrain Hexes (including 6 Sea Hexes with Desert on the Backside)
      2 Frame Pieces
     20 Treasure Tokens
      9 Canal Pieces
     12 Number Tokens
     19 Dragon Tokens (Wooden Dragon Pieces - English USA version)
     16 Cities

Name: PlusMinus
Description:
The main principle of this game is a generally known law of magnetism, saying that charged particles of the same signs repel each other and attract the opposite, in other words: plus attracts minus, minus attracts plus, plus repels plus and minus repels minus. Players, using this principle, perform actions with their pawns, aiming to place five of them in a row. The first to achieve this goal wins the game.

Each player has 45 two-sided pawns with a plus sign and a minus on the other side.

A player in his/her turn must perform: 

     place his pawn from the pool on the board 


and (if possible) 

     make one additional action out of the following: 
         repelling the pawn on the board 
         attracting the pawn on the board 
    


and (if the additional action gives such an effect) 

     a pawn's reaction after an additional action (or a sequence of pawns' reactions)

Name: Kalmár
Description: Players are merchants traveling around Europe during the renaissance. They can buy and sell goods in some important cities, but they have to beware of bandits and pirates. The first player to return to Rome with enough money and goods wins the game.

Name: Fifi's Stack-a-cake
Description: Very simple children's game. Roll the dice and put the appropriate layer on Fifi's cake - but try not to topple the whole thing.

Name: Argosy Command
Description:
Introduction text:

Argosy Command
A game of starship miniatures combat.

These rules are designed to allow players to quickly design fleets and get right to playing. Battles involving over a dozen ships per side should be resolved within a couple hours play easily. While not as detailed or full of options as several other games available, this should be appropriate for even small children to understand and enjoy until they are ready themselves to move on to more challenging rule sets. Above all, it is hoped that the rules presented here provide an enjoyable experience to all that choose to play, for a game that is without fun...is simply not a game at all.

The ships portrayed within the Argosy Command universe travel between stars by means of wormholes and may represent various races as characterized and postulated by the likes of H.G. Wells, Jules Verne, and other such literary notables at the turn of the 20th Century.

Name: Sovereignty!!
Description:
In Sovereignty!! the king has died leaving no heir to the throne.  You are a noble who sees this as an opportunity to grab power.  In order to place yourself on the throne, you will have to win the support of the people, gather valuable resources, collect taxes, raise an army, and finally obtain tactical information on your opponent. The player who uses their skills at bribery, sabotage, and brute force the most effectively will capture the throne!

This game is played over 4 rounds with opponents competing to claim 6 objective cards per round.  To do this each player places a card face down at each of the objectives.  When all cards are placed there is a showdown where players claim their gained obectives.  New objectives are then drawn, hands are refreshed, and the next round begins!  The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

This game was designed as an alternate version of the card game War with shorter game lengths and addition of decision making.  After a redo in March 2010 it is now a set collection game with 5 varying types of objectives with 7 cards of each type (3x standard card, 1x +1 bonus, 1x +2 bonus, 1x +3 bonus, and 1x +1 per card of this type).

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo
Description:
Lock ‘n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo Second Edition contains 12 new scenarios for use with the components found in Band of Heroes and Noville, Bastogne’s Outpost. From Normandy to the Hürtgen Forest, to Monte Cassino and Anzio in Italy, Battle Pack Bravo has you covered. It also includes a return to Noville, Belgium, as the Battle of the Bulge wanes down.

Battle Pack Bravo is an expansion pack of Lock ’n Load scenarios Band of Heroes and Noville, Bastogne's Outpost. It contains 12 scenarios and a new Castle map. Six of the 12 scenarios use the Band of Heroes components exclusively; the other six use components from both Band of Heroes and Noville, and two scenarios are set on the new Castle map. Two scenarios also occur on the wintry expanse of the Noville map.

Scenarios take place from Normandy to the Hürtgen Forest, at Monte Cassino and Anzio. Take part in daring prisoner rescues, slash through Normandy's Bocage with Culin-mounted Shermans, fight for Cauquigny and the La Fiere Bridge on D-Day, take on a retreating group of SS—including a Tiger—in Noville, and fight for the towns of Strass and Gey, Germany, on the edge of the Hürtgen Forest.

The scenarios are laid out in a full-color booklet, and were designed by savvy LnL specialists Dale Holmstrom, Yvan Descotes, Stéphane Tanguay, Jeff Lewis and Mark Walker.

The Castle map is printed on heavy cardstock and comes not only in its standard size (8.25” x 12.75”) but also as a free bonus X-Map, a new oversized 11” x 17” map that retains the LnL game scale but increases the size of the map and its hexes, providing a larger playing area and more space for your units and administrative markers.

Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo Second Edition brings out the Action!

Name: Doodaddy
Description:
Doodaddy is a family dice game, similar to 10,000,  where each player collects points during his/her turn, which he/she may add to his total, or not, depending on how aggressively or cautiously he/she plays.

As each player rolls during his/her turn, the player is looking to score points, in the form of sets.  If a roll scores any points, he may set aside any number of sets that he wants to claim points from, and either: 1) roll all remaining dice, hoping to score additional Sets., 2) roll all six dice again if all six dice have scored points, or 3) calculate the points and move on.  A player has to start with 500 points to get on the table.  If a roll scores nothing, the turn is forfeited, and it’s the next players turn.

Points…
a single 1 : 100
a single 5 : 50
triple of 1's : 1000
triple of 2's : 200
triple of 3's : 300
triple of 4's : 400
triple of 5's : 500
triple of 6's : 600
six-of-a-kind : Instant winner
three pair (DOODADDY) : 1,500
Straight of 6 : 1,500
Players need to reach 10,000 points to win.

Name: Master of the Elements
Description:
Master of the Elements is an element-themed part strategy, part luck card-centered game where players aspire to be the first to master the elements by one of three methods: maximum power in each element, summoning 5 spirits, or playing a 9 card mastery set.

Players take turns going through the phases each round (referred to as the "season").  Cards corresponding to the season have a bonus.  Each season, there is a lead player who chooses a special universal modifier.  It could be a draw bonus, it could be to prohibit using/summoning spirits or to prohibit special cards from being played.

The cards, spirits, element power levels, and seasons all interact in a synergistic way throughout the game.  Cards can allow you to draw more cards, put a spirit into play, or boost your element power level.  Spirits can help you draw more cards, boost your power level, and more!  Higher power levels means you may be able to draw more cards.

Do you go for element power? Can you summon enough spirits?  Do you change your strategy along the way...

Name: Spectra Forma
Description:
Matching colors and shapes is easy, right?  what about matching both at the same time, while keeping your opponents from scoring their best play? Look out for a possible spectrum bonus!  Add to the longest shape path!  And don't forget to pay attention to what pieces your opponents have left!

This strategy game is easy to learn, but challenging enough for many repeat plays.  Each player has his/her own set of colored shape pieces.  Players take turns placing pieces and scoring as they go. Will you have the most points when all the spaces have been filled?

Name: Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled Again
Description:
After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. Not all of them were kind and happy wizards, but the old royal mage made sure to leave some nasty tricks behind just for them. Traps and curses of all kinds were left strewn about his hiding places, now being plundered by the wizards seeking to replace him. Will they survive to claim the prize?

Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled again is the first exciting expansion for the group card/board game where you race around trying to get more loot than your opponents. Now, not only can you make spells to battle each other, but curse them and their items to slow them down. This crazy expansion introduces a new character (the evil Alchemist Art), the ability to play with up to two more players in a game (up to 8 when used with the basic game), and a great mix of new Spell and Loot cards to add to the mix.
